snippet: By restoring Penn State’s bowl eligibility and full complement of scholarships, the N.C.A.A. launched the program that was shamed by a sexual-abuse scandal on a course to normalcy.
abstract: NCAA restores Penn State’s postseason eligibility, removing one of the final hurdles in its football team’s path back to normalcy in the aftermath of the child sexual abuse scandal that engulfed the university nearly three years ago; decision means Penn State will be sllowed to participate in a bowl game this season and it also restores all scholarships stripped from team.

byline.original: By STEVE EDER and MARC TRACY

lead_paragraph: By restoring Penn State’s bowl eligibility and full complement of scholarships, the N.C.A.A. launched the program that was shamed by a sexual-abuse scandal on a course to normalcy.

headline.main: N.C.A.A. Decides to Roll Back Sanctions Against Penn State
headline.print_headline: N.C.A.A. Decides to Roll Back Sanctions Against Penn State
